episodeTitle: The Mysterious Band of Pirates! Sunny and the Dangerous Trap!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates depart Water 7 aboard the Thousand Sunny with Franky officially joining the crew. While sailing, they encounter a damaged ship and offer aid to what appears to be stranded fishermen. However, the crew soon discovers these are members of the Phoenix Pirates, forced to work for the Accino Family bounty hunters, who attempt to capture them with poisoned food.

events.title: Vigaro's Sacrifice Flashback
events.description: The episode opens with a dramatic flashback showing Vigaro, first mate of the Phoenix Pirates, preparing to sacrifice himself to save his captain Puzzle and crew. In the New World, facing an overwhelming enemy, Vigaro charges forward alone to buy time for his crew to escape, telling Puzzle he believes he will become the next Pirate King.
events.significance: Establishes the tragic backstory of the Phoenix Pirates and explains why they are currently in a desperate situation. Vigaro's death creates the emotional foundation for Puzzle's character arc and the crew's forced servitude to the Accino Family.

quotes.text: Puzzle... I believe you will become the next Pirate King. That's why I'm doing this.
quotes.speaker: Vigaro
quotes.context: Vigaro's final words before sacrificing himself for the crew

events.title: Debut of Opening Theme 'Jungle P'
events.description: Episode 326 marks the first use of 'Jungle P' by 5050 as the opening theme for One Piece. This opening features a unique rap section and showcases Brook's silhouette for the first time, foreshadowing his eventual introduction in the Thriller Bark arc. The opening is notably extended to 150 seconds, as ending themes were discontinued from episode 279.
events.significance: Introduces a new era of One Piece with a distinctive opening that breaks from traditional J-pop style with rap elements. Brook's appearance in the opening builds anticipation for the next crew member.

events.title: Straw Hats Enjoy the Thousand Sunny
events.description: The Straw Hat crew explores and enjoys features of their new ship, the Thousand Sunny. Luffy and Usopp successfully capture a shark for the ship's aquarium, demonstrating the ship's various amenities. This scene was adapted from manga Chapter 442, though repositioned from its original placement.
events.significance: Showcases the crew's new ship and their excitement about its features. This peaceful moment contrasts with the danger that follows and represents the crew's renewed spirit after the emotional Water 7 arc.

quotes.text: Check it out! We caught a shark for the aquarium!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excitement about the Sunny's features

events.title: Approaching Winter Waters
events.description: Nami notices the temperature dropping significantly and realizes they are approaching a winter island. The crew prepares for cold weather conditions as they continue sailing through increasingly frigid waters.
events.significance: Sets up the environmental context for the Ice Hunter arc. The winter setting creates the perfect conditions for the Accino Family's ice-based trap and establishes the harsh climate they'll be navigating.

quotes.text: The temperature is dropping fast. We must be approaching a winter island.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's observation about the changing climate

events.title: Phoenix Pirates Ship Discovered
events.description: Zoro spots a badly damaged ship floating without sails or flag. The vessel appears abandoned and in distress. The Straw Hats decide to investigate and offer assistance to the apparent survivors.
events.significance: This discovery triggers the main plot of the Ice Hunter arc. The damaged ship is the bait in the Accino Family's trap to capture high-bounty pirates.

quotes.text: There's a ship over there. Looks like it's in bad shape.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro spotting the Phoenix Pirates' damaged vessel

events.title: Puzzle and Phoenix Pirates Debut
events.description: The Straw Hats encounter the crew of the damaged ship, who claim to be fishermen attacked by pirates three days ago. Among them are Puzzle (unconscious and injured), Jiro (a young boy), Stansen (acting captain), and other crew members. Luffy, characteristically trusting, immediately invites them aboard for food and medical treatment.
events.significance: Introduces the Phoenix Pirates, the central non-canon characters of the Ice Hunter arc. Puzzle's unconscious state hides his true identity as a 100-million berry bounty pirate captain, setting up later revelations.

quotes.text: We're just fishermen. We were attacked by pirates three days ago and barely escaped with our lives.
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen lying to the Straw Hats about their identity

quotes.text: No problem! Come aboard! We'll give you food and help!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's immediate offer of assistance

events.title: Chopper Treats the Injured
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper examines the Phoenix Pirates crew in his new medical office on the Thousand Sunny. He treats Puzzle and Jiro, showcasing the ship's medical facilities. Chopper's professional care demonstrates his growth as the crew's doctor.
events.significance: Shows off the Thousand Sunny's medical bay and Chopper's dedication to healing anyone in need, regardless of whether they're friend or foe. This compassion will later be exploited by the Phoenix Pirates.

quotes.text: Don't worry, I'll make sure you're all better!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper treating the injured Phoenix Pirates

events.title: Stansen Contacts the Accino Family
events.description: While pretending to be grateful, Stansen secretly uses a transponder snail to contact someone, revealing that they've captured the Straw Hat Pirates with their 600-million berry total bounty. He receives orders to proceed with the plan to deliver them to the Accino Family.
events.significance: Reveals the Phoenix Pirates' true intentions and establishes them as antagonists working under duress for the Accino Family. This betrayal sets up the central conflict of the arc.

quotes.text: We have them. The Straw Hat Pirates. Their total bounty is over 600 million berries.
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen secretly reporting to the Accino Family

quotes.text: Good. Proceed with the plan. Don Accino is waiting for his birthday present.
quotes.speaker: Salchow
quotes.context: Accino Family member giving orders

events.title: The Poisoned Feast
events.description: The Phoenix Pirates offer the Straw Hats wine and food as supposed thanks for their help. Stansen brings wine to the crew, which contains a sleeping poison. Most of the Straw Hat crew begins eating and drinking, unaware of the danger.
events.significance: The Phoenix Pirates execute their trap to capture the Straw Hats. This betrayal of hospitality represents the desperate situation the Phoenix Pirates are in, forced to betray their own pirate code.

quotes.text: Please, accept this wine as our thanks for your kindness.
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen offering poisoned wine to the Straw Hats

events.title: Sanji, Robin, and Franky See Through the Deception
events.description: As most of the crew succumbs to the sleeping poison, Sanji, Robin, and Franky reveal they never consumed the food or wine, having suspected the Phoenix Pirates' intentions from the start. They confront the would-be captors, demanding the truth about who they really are.
events.significance: Demonstrates the perceptiveness of the more cautious Straw Hat members. Their suspicion prevents total disaster and shows character growth - the crew has learned to be more careful after past betrayals.

quotes.text: Did you really think we'd fall for such an obvious trap? We never touched your poisoned food.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji revealing they saw through the deception

quotes.text: Now, who are you really? And who sent you?
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin demanding answers

events.title: Confrontation on the Thousand Sunny
events.description: A brief fight breaks out between Sanji, Robin, Franky and the Phoenix Pirates members Guyle, Sutton, and Basil. Before the battle can conclude, Stansen orders a tactical retreat, recognizing they're outmatched by the three Straw Hats who remained conscious.
events.significance: Shows that the Phoenix Pirates are not particularly powerful fighters and are acting out of desperation rather than confidence. Their quick retreat sets up the pursuit in the next episode.

quotes.text: Fall back! We can't win against them!
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen ordering retreat after realizing they're outmatched

events.title: Don Accino's Birthday Celebration
events.description: The scene shifts to Lovely Land, the Accino Family headquarters deep within Hyokaido. Don Accino, a large man surrounded by captured pirate flags, celebrates his birthday with his family. They eagerly await his birthday present - the capture and flag of the Straw Hat Pirates. The room is decorated with Art Nouveau architecture and tropical warmth despite the frozen surroundings.
events.significance: Introduces Don Accino, the main antagonist of the Ice Hunter arc, and establishes the Accino Family's modus operandi of collecting pirate flags as trophies. The birthday setup creates urgency for capturing the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Papa, we're throwing a wonderful birthday party for you! And your present will arrive soon - the Straw Hat Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Campacino
quotes.context: Accino's son announcing the birthday plans

quotes.text: The Straw Hats... their flag will make a fine addition to my collection.
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Don Accino anticipating his birthday present

events.title: Phoenix Pirates' Regret
events.description: After retreating to their ship with the unconscious Straw Hats, members of the Phoenix Pirates express guilt and regret about betraying people who showed them kindness. They reveal they are being forced to work for the Accino Family and have no choice but to deliver the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Humanizes the Phoenix Pirates and establishes them as sympathetic antagonists rather than villains. Their moral conflict sets up their eventual alliance with the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: I don't like this... They were nice to us, and we poisoned them.
quotes.speaker: Jiro
quotes.context: Jiro expressing guilt about the betrayal

quotes.text: We have no choice. If we don't deliver them, the Accino Family will never give us back our flag, and Captain Puzzle's dream will die.
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen explaining their impossible situation

quotes.text: Puzzle... I believe you will become the next Pirate King. That's why I'm doing this.
quotes.speaker: Vigaro
quotes.context: Vigaro's final words before sacrificing himself in the flashback

quotes.text: The temperature is dropping fast. We must be approaching a winter island.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami observing the climate change

quotes.text: There's a ship over there. Looks like it's in bad shape.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Spotting the Phoenix Pirates' vessel

quotes.text: No problem! Come aboard! We'll give you food and help!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy offering assistance to the supposed fishermen

quotes.text: We have them. The Straw Hat Pirates. Their total bounty is over 600 million berries.
quotes.speaker: Stansen
quotes.context: Stansen secretly reporting to the Accino Family

quotes.text: Did you really think we'd fall for such an obvious trap? We never touched your poisoned food.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Revealing they saw through the deception

quotes.text: Papa, we're throwing a wonderful birthday party for you! And your present will arrive soon - the Straw Hat Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Campacino
quotes.context: Announcing Don Accino's birthday plans

quotes.text: I don't like this... They were nice to us, and we poisoned them.
quotes.speaker: Jiro
quotes.context: Expressing guilt about the betrayal

themes.description: The episode explores how desperate circumstances can force good people to commit acts of betrayal. The Phoenix Pirates are not evil but are forced to betray the kind Straw Hats to save their captain and reclaim their flag.
themes.symbolism: The poisoned feast represents the corruption of hospitality and trust, showing how the Accino Family's oppression forces others to violate sacred pirate codes.
culturalReferences: Japanese concepts of on (obligation) and giri (duty)

themes.description: Luffy's immediate trust contrasts with Sanji, Robin, and Franky's cautious skepticism. The episode shows both the beauty of Luffy's trusting nature and the practical wisdom of being careful.
themes.symbolism: The split between the trusting crew members who ate the poisoned food and the cautious ones who abstained represents the balance needed between openness and self-preservation.

themes.description: Vigaro's sacrifice flashback establishes themes of selfless leadership and the weight of responsibility that comes with being a captain. His death haunts Puzzle and drives the Phoenix Pirates' actions.
themes.symbolism: Vigaro charging alone into battle while his crew escapes mirrors the sacrificial nature of true first mates and the bonds between pirate crew members.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced in an unconscious state, recovering from severe injuries sustained protecting his crew in the New World. His comatose condition hides his 100-million berry bounty status and sets up his character arc of regaining the will to fight.
keyActions: Appears unconscious throughout the episode
Receives medical treatment from Chopper
Shown in flashback with Vigaro

characterSpotlights.role: Flashback character establishing Phoenix Pirates backstory
characterSpotlights.development: Shown sacrificing himself in the New World to save his captain and crew. His death serves as the emotional catalyst for the Phoenix Pirates' current desperate situation and Puzzle's trauma.
keyActions: Sacrifices himself to save the Phoenix Pirates
Expresses belief in Puzzle becoming Pirate King
Dies fighting overwhelming enemy forces
quotes: Puzzle... I believe you will become the next Pirate King. That's why I'm doing this.

characterSpotlights.role: Youngest Phoenix Pirate and moral conscience
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a young, earnest member of the Phoenix Pirates who clearly feels guilty about betraying the Straw Hats. His youth and honesty make him sympathetic despite his crew's deception.
keyActions: Receives medical treatment from Chopper
Participates in the deception reluctantly
Expresses guilt about poisoning the Straw Hats
quotes: I don't like this... They were nice to us, and we poisoned them.

characterSpotlights.development: Takes on leadership while Puzzle is incapacitated. Demonstrates pragmatism and strategic thinking, but also shows the burden of making difficult choices under the Accino Family's control.
keyActions: Deceives the Straw Hats about being fishermen
Contacts the Accino Family via transponder snail
Orders tactical retreat when outmatched
Explains the crew's impossible situation
quotes: We have them. The Straw Hat Pirates. Their total bounty is over 600 million berries.
We have no choice. If we don't deliver them, the Accino Family will never give us back our flag.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a powerful, lazy patriarch celebrating his birthday while his family hunts the Straw Hats. His collection of pirate flags reveals his twisted hobby and establishes him as a formidable bounty hunter.
keyActions: Celebrates birthday at Lovely Land
Awaits the Straw Hats as his birthday present
Displays his collection of captured pirate flags
quotes: The Straw Hats... their flag will make a fine addition to my collection.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows character growth through his caution and suspicion. Unlike earlier arcs where he might be distracted, Sanji remains focused and sees through the Phoenix Pirates' deception.
keyActions: Avoids consuming the poisoned food and drink
Confronts the Phoenix Pirates when they're exposed
Fights to protect the unconscious crew members
quotes: Did you really think we'd fall for such an obvious trap? We never touched your poisoned food.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her characteristic caution and perceptiveness, immediately suspicious of the supposed fishermen and avoiding their trap.
keyActions: Avoids the poisoned feast
Demands answers about the Phoenix Pirates' true identity
Helps defend the ship
quotes: Now, who are you really? And who sent you?

characterSpotlights.role: New crew member proving his worth
characterSpotlights.development: As the newest Straw Hat, Franky demonstrates his value by being perceptive enough to avoid the trap and powerful enough to help defend the crew.
keyActions: Avoids the poisoned food
Fights alongside Sanji and Robin
Shows loyalty to his new crew

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's characteristic trust and kindness are on full display as he immediately offers help to the supposed fishermen without suspicion. This leads to him being poisoned but also showcases his pure-hearted nature.
keyActions: Invites the Phoenix Pirates aboard without hesitation
Catches a shark for the aquarium
Falls victim to the sleeping poison
quotes: No problem! Come aboard! We'll give you food and help!
Check it out! We caught a shark for the aquarium!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's dedication to healing anyone in need is shown through his treatment of Puzzle and Jiro, demonstrating his medical skills and kind heart.
keyActions: Examines and treats the Phoenix Pirates in his medical bay
Shows concern for Puzzle's condition
Falls victim to the sleeping poison
quotes: Don't worry, I'll make sure you're all better!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her navigational expertise by detecting the climate change and approaching winter island, showing her continued growth as the crew's navigator.
keyActions: Detects temperature change indicating winter island
Guides the Sunny through changing weather
Falls victim to the sleeping poison
quotes: The temperature is dropping fast. We must be approaching a winter island.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro spots the damaged Phoenix Pirates ship first, showing his vigilance even when relaxing. Despite this awareness, he still falls for the poison.
keyActions: Spots the Phoenix Pirates' damaged vessel
Remains somewhat suspicious but not enough
Falls victim to the sleeping poison
quotes: There's a ship over there. Looks like it's in bad shape.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ice Hunter arc is anime-only filler and does not appear in the manga. The arc was created to provide spacing between the end of Water 7/Enies Lobby and the beginning of Thriller Bark.

The scene with Luffy and Usopp catching a shark for the aquarium was adapted from manga Chapter 442, but in the manga this scene occurs after arriving at the Florian Triangle (around episode 337 in anime timeline) and features different hijinks.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first use of 'Jungle P' by 5050 as the opening theme. The song features a distinctive rap section that makes it unique among One Piece openings.
Episode 326 is the first episode of the Ice Hunter arc, which runs for 10 episodes (326-335). This is a filler arc that takes place between the Water 7 Saga and Thriller Bark arc.

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The opening theme 'Jungle P' features Brook's silhouette for the first time, even though Brook doesn't officially join the crew until the Thriller Bark arc. This serves as foreshadowing for anime viewers.

Starting from episode 326, the opening themes were extended from 110 seconds to 150 seconds because ending themes were discontinued from episode 279. Ending themes would not return until episode 1071, 17 years later.
Puzzle, the captain of the Phoenix Pirates, has a 100,000,000 berry bounty, making him a significant pirate despite being a filler character.

Don Accino's Devil Fruit, the Atsu Atsu no Mi (Hot-Hot Fruit), allows him to reach temperatures of up to 10,000 degrees, making him one of the most temperature-extreme Devil Fruit users in the series.
The Ice Hunter arc is sometimes referred to as the 'Lovely Land Arc' after the Accino Family's headquarters location.

sources.title: Never Watched One Piece - Lovely Land Arc

trivia.fact: Episode 326 has an IMDb rating of 6.7/10, which is lower than the series average, reflecting the generally lukewarm reception of filler arcs.
